author: {'steamid': '76561198037112838', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1665292314}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34294631/] Follow Far2close - Visual Novel Playthroughs Curator Page [/url]
[b]The Falconers: Moonlight[/b]
Developer: Bionic Penguin
Publisher: Sekai Project

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]1.[/b]
Cryptids and other strange creatures lurk among humanity; preying indiscriminately or targeted attacks on the innocent. Some have high defense  systems that require a set of skills and tools in order to bring it down. That is where The Falconers come in; monster hunters trained specifically for these situations. Cassandra Winter is on her first solo mission investigating the small town of Moonlight in 19th century New Zealand on the numerous disappearances of the locals. Upon searching the initial spot of the most recent victim, she encounters a Culler (a huge insect larger than man) holding the remains of a resident. After dispatching it, she discovers a whole nest and realizes that the problem has gotten much worse and time is quickly ticking.
	The story is pretty short but it does do a solid job at establishing the town of Moonlight, its origins, its residents, and the overall outlook of life in it along with helping set up Cassandra's character. The one thing I'd like to highlight is the cultural aspect. Monsters are heavily reliant on cultures, religions, and other beliefs. I bring this up due to the character of Wiremu "Weka" Jones. He is of Māori blood,  indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand and his culture adds in so much to the Cullers of [b]The Falconers: Moonlight[/b] by his peoples views on them and their past interactions with them signifying that there may be more to the Cullers than blind hostility. Monsters can be one thing, you can just have a wolf and go on, but beliefs help establish a monster. Without belief, there is no fear. It's like God purging humanity of their sins using angels, Mothman being a sign of disaster coming, or summoning Bloody Mary via the mirror. 
[b]2.[/b]
The characters are well written such as Cassandra's skills like sharpshooting, investigation, and keeping calm under pressure, but also her worries [spoiler] that due to her inexperience as a solo Falconer; she might fail the town of Moonlight. [/spoiler] A lot of the residents possess their own beef and are all suspects under Cassandra's watch. Captain Moonlight is wealthy and took over the town along with changing the name from its previous one. He mostly means well but some suspect he might be a bit narcissistic and only chase after monetary gain. Bridget "Biddy" Goodwin is extremely cynical and has seen her fair share of pain and injustice. With her town slowly going down the train (according to her) she drinks herself to relief while possessing heavy underlying guilt. Mary "Sunlight" Suncliffe is the towns shining beacon, her positivity along with her welcoming nature help everyone take a rest at her hostel. Wiremu "Weka" Jones is a professional gambler albeit in a illegal means, he is similar to Cassandra in a way as he is a drifter and trust is hard to give. He is insightful and is rarely one to become angry. All the characters are well written and all their connections with each other help pave the story in their different viewpoints (depending on your choices).
[b]3.[/b] I love the art by [url=https://rusharil.wordpress.com/]Ares[/url], it is gritty and fits extremely well with the overall atmosphere. The old dusty exterior of the town, tavern, and mines. The humidity and danger of the gloomy forest and the dread upon witnessing a mass burial. The sprite art looks great even if it may be lacking some variety or possess some oddities. The CG art I absolutely love, especially when it shows the Culler and some showing off Cassandra in her best/worst moments.
[b]4.[/b]
The music by [url=https://soundcloud.com/manuelmarino/tracks]Manuel Marino[/url] is fantastic. The main menu music "Hunting" shows the tense moments of a hunt by introducing a calm beginning and an intense continuation after it. "Discovery" plays a pivotal moment in the game too as this takes places when Cassandra [spoiler] finds out that there is a Seedling somewhere.[/spoiler] the absolute dread in this track shows the pure horror in it all. "Conversation" takes a step back from the dread and places in a more somber moment, this primarily takes place when Cassandra chats with Wiremu. It adds in that bonding moment especially when [spoiler] Cassandra and Wiremu talk about themselves and how they came to be.[/spoiler] "Conflict" plays a great moment not only as the credits music but also highlighting the fights in this visual novel. The track is intense and it makes it feel like each fight can be Cassandra's last and the stakes have been raised. There is also the music used in the opening as well and that one is great.




[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]1.[/b]
My primary complaint is that the story is [b]heavily[/b] linear that makes the choices you take not exactly important to the story. The only impact the choices in the whole story is mainly different dialogue or conversing with different characters. The choices that do heavily impact the story happens in the end where [spoiler] 2 specific characters can die, but not in the same playthrough[/spoiler] and the choice whether to stay in Moonlight or abandon the mission. I believe a third option could have been possible where Cassandra [spoiler] dies if you make the wrong choices.[/spoiler] A fourth option could have been possible where you can [spoiler]investigate Mary "Sunlight" Suncliffe during your standoff with Bridget "Biddy" Goodwin.[/spoiler] but I understand why things happened as they did as it does show Cassandra's unfamiliar position as a solo Falconer.
[b]2.[/b]
The sprites are very limited, mainly being one or two poses for each character with minor variation in how they are standing.. Cassandra's sprite's left eye (My Left, Her Right) looks a bit too far.


[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Although very linear despite having choices, The Falconers: Moonlight does a great job in establishing the lore of the world along with its characters and the atmosphere, art, and music are also fantastic.



[b]Score:[/b] 8/10 GREAT

review:
I mainly bought this game for the inclusion of New Zealand related history and cultural references, not realising that this visual novel is based on an existing novel already.

I cannot speak to the authenticity that it has for the original work, but I thought it was a fine short VN that allows the player some variability in their choices (although there's not that many choices to be had).

Because I waited ages before playing this game, I forgot that it has a scary and bloody mystery to solve in a West Coast mining village - so it's not your typical sunshine and rainbows VN.

If all that sounds fine, then if you think you'd enjoy it I'd say go ahead for introducing an atypical story in an under-explored location in video games. Having said that, you might want to pick this up on sale as I don't think two hours or more really warrants full price (other than for the art and translation into Thai), but you can be the judge of that.

review:
Two hour visual novel mystery about hunting down John Carpenter's the Thing in a mining town.

There's a weird moment where your buddy Weka reveals his tribe previously lived in peace with the Cullers/Seeders/monsters before the Europeans showed up. And its this moment that changes the entire premise on its head. Maybe the Falconers are in the wrong for hunting down these creatures. Claiming that the Seeders "can't feel anything" and "only imitate human behavior" suddenly seems like such blatant propaganda. Maybe these are people just hiding out and trying to survive, rather than cause wanton destruction like your bosses claim.

But then all it really leads to is a villain monologue from the twist antagonist about the evils of humanity.

Just kinda lost me after that, y'know?

review:
Let me explain in this way. What am I guessing is that when the creators were making this game, they thought of something along the lines of 'making something cool!" 
And as a result, they did make something cool. That is all, It's only cool and nothing more.

This game doesn't have any kind of direction for its motive. Things happens in this game, but I don't have any kind of reason to care for it. The game just moves by itself, without thinking about me. It's not trying to take my interest; All it does is moving the mystery.

As a player you keep asking to yourself: "Why should I care about this or that?"
The characters for an example. They purely exist for giving you the information you need, so the main character plays it cool and talks smoothly with them. Alright, but why should I care about the main character's objection?
The game doesn't even give you a clear explanation on what she wishes for. In certain stories that is fine, but you gotta put some kind of thing for the reader to care about. Especially at the beginning.
The way this visual novel starts... Just plainly direct. When the opening started I couldn't believe it, What I had just witnessed did not felt like a prologue at all; It was just a boring casual scene and nothing more.

The side characters has their own problems which connects with the mystery. 
They'll get in your way and that fact will make them unlikable. Every single trait of theirs is connected with the mystery that I have no reason to care about, so bye bye the possibility of me caring about the characters.

What do you think is the biggest mistake that this game made? 
No music. 
I do not care even a bit if it has some in it... It rarely plays anything. Like, that is probably one of the worst choices that you could possibly make in a mystery visual novel where you needed to have the reader's attention. You could give the characters some cool tracks, and from the music we would 'feel' those characters. 
Maybe that would make it way easier to read the dialouge.(I was sleepy while playing the game.) 

That said, I was not expecting this game to work on my laptop; considering its high quality look and effects. It is definitely one of the most beautiful looking EVN ever made. It looks cool, very cool.

Yes, just cool-looking. That is all there's to it.

review:
[b]The Falconers: Moonlight[/b] is:
- A supernatural thriller 
- Western-styled and action-packed
- Set in New Zealand
- Ruddy amazing

Stories like these are pretty unique for VNs, and [b]Moonlight[/b] pulls it off with aplomb. Fast pacing, memorable characters and the cinematic production qualities (the best I've seen by a mile - "Dynamic Camera" indeed!) bring this VN to life - my only reservation is that [b]Moonlight[/b] has yet to receive a VN sequel, which is positively criminal. More adventures for Cassie Winters, please!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013453809', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1578087845}
review:
A fine story, appropriate characters, and a great atmosphere (set up by the art, music and sound effects). This is more of a kinetic novel than a game though.

Things to know going in:
It's short (2-3 hours of casual reading)
Your choices don't really matter that much(pretty much just for the achievements and small amounts of world building)
DON'T TREAT IT LIKE A GAME! (Really can't stress this enough with most visual/kinetic novels, most of them are not crazy tree branching multi-directional worlds. They're telling a story and SOME things change on your input.)

In short, if you know what you're going in for, there's no real reason to dislike this "game" beside maybe a few odd grammar choices. My biggest gripe is that there doesn't seem to be more of these stories because The Falconers' world seems like a very interesting setting.

review:
前期是一个侦探+悬疑的故事，后期有一些作者对人性的思考，阴暗也有光辉。本篇VN无爱情，流程短, 引人深思，音乐表现不佳。

近期所有看的VN里，这绝对是个有深度的好本子。
被蒙蔽的恶魔猎人，屠杀毛利人的殖民者，驱使恶魔杀害白人的毛利人，播种罪恶的恶魔，各怀心思的镇民。
倒数第二章极其讽刺，这一出悲剧里，谁才是真正的culler，又有谁是无辜的呢？
恶魔动动嘴，结出的恶之果甚至超出了恶魔自己的预期。
每个人都屈从于内心的恶魔，你看完也一定会想起巫师3石之心里的那首歌谣的。
His smile fair as Spring, as towards him he draws you
His tongue sharp and silvery, as he implores you
Your wishes he grants, as he swears to adore you
————————————————————————————————————
剧本：7/10
前期比较模式化，性格描写的不太详细。剧本立意很高，很少见到一整片VN全是探讨人性的。无爱情无宿命。不过千万别拿这个当一个侦探剧，女主是一个新手恶魔猎人，经验有限，当你已经知道谁是恶魔的时候，还不得不看着女主在歪路上越跑越远的时候，真·气人女主。这个方面很大程度限制了自由度，不过考虑到这是一个VN，这个影响并不大。（喜爱在游戏里自己做决定的，可以移步   福尔摩斯罪与罚）、

人物塑造我个人觉得biddy是最成功的，矛盾人格的累加不但不出戏，反而让人物非常饱满。另外女主小姐姐真棒呆（CG也帅！）单刷怪兽，勇于承认自己的错误并努力弥补，在迷茫的时候依然能履行职责，事后还归功于很多帮助她的人，这才是真正的大女主！国内那些一路开挂的玛丽苏和傻白甜真是沙雕……
其他两个男性角色就没留下那么深刻的印象了……
作者打算把这个Falconers做成系列IP（全是女主的那种……），第二部他写了小说Falconers：Fort Eden。（主角换人了）
CG里的树很新西兰，对的，新西兰的树就长得这么魔幻。。……

音乐：3/10
如果你是一个没有音乐就读不下去VN的，千万别买，整部剧不超过4首音乐，而且每个都非常短（虽然每首都挺好的，但太少了）。大部分都是环境音和音效，还有大段没声音的地方。

英文友好度：6/10
心理描写偶有长难句，词汇丰富，人物对话部分简单
故事发生在新西兰（看剧情应该是南岛），文中有不少新西兰独有的英文词汇和毛利语，也还原了一些旧式英语的句式（双重否定用来加强语气，而不是表示肯定）可以说是很用心了，不过这些给阅读带来了一些困难。讨论区第一语言为英语的单线需要花3小时看完剧本。我单线花了两倍时间QAQ。但还是推荐。如果有一天有CV就好了

author: {'steamid': '76561198234584076', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1552217438}
review:
[i] The Falconers: Moonlight [/i] is a supernatural thriller visual novel set in the 19th Century West Coast New Zealand. That unique western atmosphere was truly enjoyable. It's fantasy fiction, so don't expect historical accuracy. The novel is relatively short (40,000 words) with only three endings but it felt like it totally deserved that tag 'story rich' as the game has quite interesting lore. I like how not too many details were weaved into the plot at the beginning, a player has to guess some things (which is not that difficult actually) but later we easily see the full picture. 

I sincerely enjoyed the plot. It was gripping enough, had some gory moments that made me gasp. In general the story felt well balanced for me, sometimes it was repulsive but it really didn't go too far in its revolting part. So it was scary enough for me, I really find disgusting all those [spoiler] centipedes, maggots and...stuff like that [/spoiler] but at the same time it wasn't focused too much on any nasty details.

What I especially enjoyed in the story is a cool enough female MC, so self-insertion felt quite nice for a change. The story actually proves later that she is far from perfect but it somehow doesn't spoil her image at all, on the contrary makes her more realistic. Such a rare case for me that I love female MC in visual novels. That's the reason enough to make this review positive.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1678850179 
English is excellent! Except 'no-one' with a hyphen I didn't notice any typos. Writing in general is rather pleasant. All in all it was such a nice experience that I'd like to have a series of Falconer stories. I hope 'Moonlight' won't be the last one released on steam.
 
Art is quite pretty! Some CGs are just gorgeous! Plus the game has animated action scenes. Sometimes it felt not like playing a game but watching anime. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1678720578
There's only one tiny thing I'd like to whine about a bit. Autoplay is that slow so I couldn't use it. Recently I started using this feature a lot. It helps to relax without constant clicking and what is most important prevents me from getting distracted too much. As I usually manage to answer messages, surf the net and do lots of other stuff while playing, so I kinda found a solution for this! But sadly not here. Nothing too important but still it was a bit annoying.

So, I can't say I was overexcited playing this game but it was nice enough to recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327809', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1547082912}
review:
One of the telltale hallmarks that you're taking part in a good fantasy story of any stripe, may be it set in an fantasy world completely separate from Earth or one that mixes our world with fantasy elements, is that if it can set up its world in such a way where it tells you enough about the setting for you to get by without getting bogged down in tons of exposition and lots of proper nouns. The Falconers is one such story, a game that does a great job doing a standalone story establishing an interesting world and cast of characters, ends conclusively, but sets up off enough stuff that you want to see more of it.

Falconers takes place in 1800’s New Zealand on an Earth where humanity has had to contend with a species of monstrous bug creatures that have lurked in the shadows for centuries. The Falconers are an organization founded to fight them and Cassie Winter is one of them, sent to the frontier town of Moonlight to investigate a rash of strange murders. Falconers has a bunch of good beats similar to some other supernatural hunting fantasy games such as Unavowed, Gabriel Knight, and Witcher. The historical setting is really cool too, as I said in my Detention, representing different times and places in games is nothing but a good thing, even if they got monsters in 'em.

Falconers is overall a really good VN. The art is good and the scene transitions are quite nice. The music is good as well. The writing is some real quality stuff, the characters are fleshed out nicely and it’s pretty concise with its narration compared to a lot of VNs which just drag with constant repetition and spinning of wheels. It’s just a really engaging two hour long VN that captures the feeling of a good short story or one-off episode of a show, gives you a nice conclusion but leaves you wanting more. I know I do and hope that this isn’t the last we’ll see of Cassie Winter, Giant Bug Hunter.

review:
This is a short but amazing visual novel. The characters are flawed yet grounded in colonial times. Out heroine Cassie is so "no-nonsense" that her authority carries this thriller through and through. It's definitely worth the price, and the way the background and scene transitions from one another is one of the best I've ever seen. Those who worry about no romance should still try out this novel, as each character in this is very charming. 
The premise if simple, falconer hunts monsters. Yet the way the story unravels slowly tells you that it is not as simple as the heroine view it to be. It is a battle viewed as Nature vs. Man, Colonizers and the Indigenous fighting and trying to live with each other.
The only gripe is that Cassie is a protagonists I wish to see in the future. So I'm asking fro a sequel. The dynamic of man and monsters should be explored more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022987140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1543114795}
review:
Hoped for a good game: found one of the best visual novels on Steam.

The Falconers: Moonlight paints an intriguing world. On one side it's an old New Zealand frontier setting that Americans won't find too strange compared to a western or similar. On the other a fancinating horror setting that leaves you curious as to just how intelligent these "Cullers" may be and how widespread The Order of the Falcon might be. 


Well crafted adventure. I'm surprised by how much depth it offers. Enough to build its world without long monologues and leave you wanting more stories in the same world. [b]Really, it's awesome. If there was a Kindle book series to follow this up, or VN sequels hitting Steam: I'd so buy them.[/b] Falconers is worth [u]full[/u] price, and at time of writing is 50% off for the Steam Autumn 2018 sale.

Most VNs on Steam tend to fall more under Bishojo and H games. Which are entertaining in their own ways. Falconers is more a Choose Your Own Adventure novel--and extremely well executed as such. It's the kind of adventure book I would have read as a kid but it's not a story for children unless you want to give them nightmares.

Someone put a lot of care into writing this VN. No slouch at the sound effects or the art either. It's also very well polished compared to a lot of VN on Steam.

review:
This visual novel is a supernatural thriller set in 19th Century New Zealand. You play as Cassie Winter, a Falconer (a hunter of the supernatural), who has come to the mining town of Moonlight to investigate a series of deaths and disappearances. A Culler is apparently at work.

This appears to be intended as the first of a series detailing this Falconer organization as it faces threats across the colonies of the European powers. Cullers are supernatural entities that basically act as a force trying to preserve the untamed wilderness from the encroachment of civilization.

This tale is well-worth its price.

review:
The Falconers: Moonlight surprised me in a number of ways, and all of them were positive.

Firstly, though short, the story was engaging throughout. Mystery and action have been skillfully interwoven, with each covering for the other's lulls. The characters are more than interesting enough for a novel this size though in future instalments i'd love to see more developed individuals that readers can form a bond with.

Being from New Zealand myself, i'd never expected a visual novel to be set in my home country but...here we are, and it's more or less everything I could hope for. The New Zealand setting is used to the novel's advantage without bludgeoning the reader with unnecessary information. While a few pieces of terminology that may not be familiar to everyone could have been better explained, the way Falconers touches on history and culture gives it a sense of believability. I found the use of one particular concept of Maori legend to be particularly praiseworthy, though I won't go on to spoil anything here.

Finally, Falconers really shines when it comes to technical quality. While the sprite art can feel a little off it's of far better quality than most other indie VNs on Steam and the CGs are all excellent. Visual effects are used expertly to make the VN feel far more alive than even most of the original Japanese VNs i've read to date and I can't wait to see more of that in future projects. Finally, the atmospheric sound effects go a long way toward promoting immersion while reading and the background music tracks cover the remaining ground (even if I wouldn't listen to them outside of the novel).

tl;dr

An indie visual novel of quality. Story, characters and especially technical effects surpassing the majority of visual novels available on Steam. New Zealand setting intriguing and well done without being overbearing, but be prepared to look up a word or two.

review:
"The Falconers: Moonlight" เป็น VN ที่จะพาคุณย้อนเวลากลับไปสู่ศตวรรษที่ 19 ในนิวซีแลนด์อันเป็นยุคแห่งจักรวรรดินิยมและการล่าอาณานิคม โดยเรื่องราวนั้นจะถูกบอกเล่าผ่านมุมมองของนักล่าอสูรสาวนามว่า “แคสแซนดรา วินเทอร์” ผู้ที่ถูกส่งมายังเมืองเล็ก ๆ ที่ชื่อ “มูนไลท์” เพื่อค้นหาคำตอบเกี่ยวกับปริศนาการหายตัวไปอย่างลึกลับของชาวเมือง  และภารกิจดังกล่าวก็คือสิ่งที่ได้ชักนำไปสู่สถานการณ์อันหนักหนาเกินกว่าที่เธอจะคาดถึง

ออกจะฟังดูแล้วเป็นอารัมภบทที่น่าสนใจ  แต่ขอสารภาพตามตรงว่าตัวผมเองอดที่จะลังเลเสียมิได้ว่าควรที่จะกดแนะนำ VN เรื่องนี้ดีหรือไม่  เพราะมีองค์ประกอบหลายอย่างภายในเกมที่ผมชอบ  แต่ก็มีองค์ประกอบจำนวนไม่น้อยเช่นกันที่ทำให้ผมรู้สึกขัดใจ (ซึ่งต้องขอกล่าวว่าอาจจะเกิดขึ้นจากรสนิยมของผมเองที่ออกจะแปลกแยกและแตกต่างไปจากชาวบ้านเขา)

สิ่งที่ผมชอบเกี่ยวกับเกมก็เห็นจะเป็นไอเดียเกี่ยวกับ “Falconers” (ชื่อเรียกของนักล่าอสูรภายในเกม) และอสูรกายอย่าง “The Cullers” (เป็นอสูรกายที่มีอำนาจเหนือธรรมชาติและมีลักษณะคล้ายแมลง) ที่ถูกหยิบยกจับมาใส่ในฉากหลังซึ่งเป็นเกาะนิวซีแลนด์ในยุคหลังการมาถึงของชาวยุโรปได้อย่างลงตัว  และเนื้อหาในภาพรวมของเกมก็ทำออกมาได้น่าติดตามอยู่ไม่น้อย

แต่สิ่งที่ผมรู้สึกไม่ชอบเลยเกี่ยวกับเกมก็เห็นจะเป็นเนื้อหาของเกมที่ดำเนินไปอย่างรีบเร่งจนเกินควร  VN เรื่องนี้ทำให้คุณรู้สึกเหมือนกับกำลังนั่งอ่านเรื่องสั้นหรือนั่งดูซีรีย์ตอนหนึ่งเสียมากกว่า  ซึ่งในการเล่นรอบแรก  ผมสามารถที่จะอ่านมันจนจบในเวลาแค่เพียงราว ๆ สองชั่วโมงเท่านั้น  และเมื่อเทียบกับราคา (329.-)  VN เรื่องนี้ก็จัดได้ว่ามีค่าตัวที่แพงเอาเรื่อง (โดยเฉพาะอย่างยิ่งถ้าหยิบไปเทียบกับเกมอื่น ๆ จาก Publisher เดียวกัน)

และด้วยเหตุที่ตัวเกมนั้นเล่าเรื่องแบบรวบรัดเอามาก ๆ  คุณจึงไม่สู้จะรู้สึกผูกพันหรือยินดียินร้ายกับการอยู่หรือตายตัวละครอื่นใดนอกไปจากแคสซีซึ่งเป็นตัวเอกสักเท่าไหร่  นับได้ว่าเป็นเรื่องที่ออกจะน่าเสียดาย  เพราะปูมหลังและความสัมพันธ์ของตัวละครนั้นได้ถูกผูกเอาไว้เป็นอย่างดี  ทว่าการคลายปมปริศนามันออกจะรวบรัดตัดความและทำได้ไม่ดีสักเท่าไหร่

อีกสิ่งหนึ่งที่ควรค่าต่อการกล่าวถึงก็เห็นจะเป็นภาพประกอบและดนตรี  ผมขอสรุปแบบตัดความว่าดีงาม  โดยเฉพาะภาพประกอบในฉากการเผชิญหน้ากับพวกอสูรกาย (ตัวเกมมี Blood & Gore ในระดับที่กำลังดี ไม่มากหรือน้อยจนเกินพอดี  ซึ่งก็นับได้เป็นจุดดี)  กระนั้นผมก็ไม่ค่อยชอบการออกแบบของตัวละครชายทั้งสองสักเท่าไหร่ (อันนี้เป็นเรื่องรสนิยม ซึ่งผมคิดว่าคงจะมีหลายคนที่เห็นต่าง)

โดยรวมแล้ว “The Falconers: Moonlight” จัดได้เป็นบทแรกของการผจญภัยที่ทำออกมาได้ดีพอใช้  และเป็น VN ที่ผมอยากจะให้คุณลองได้อ่านทันทีที่มันลดราคา (หรือมีการปรับราคาให้สมเหตุสมผลมากขึ้นกว่านี้อีกสักหน่อย)

++ มีภาษาไทย
+ VN แนวลึกลับสอบสวนที่มีฉากหลังสดใหม่
+ ภาพประกอบและดนตรีที่เข้าขั้นดีงาม
- ตัวเกมสั้นมาก ๆ เมื่อเทียบกับราคา

review:
This Is a really good game and has a very interesting concept behind it. A bit on the short side so wait for a sale but well worth a purchase. I would love to see more from this team.

Art: 8/10

The art style is really well done. It may only suit some peoples tastes but the facial expressions and character design are great. The background has just enough details but doesn't overwhelm their figures.

Story: 7/10

The story is great but like I said on the short side. You get a feel for the characters but it moves quickly so when some die it doesn't have the impact a longer story would have. That being said I'm a great fan of supernatural works and the 'Cullers' are very interesting and I would love to get to know more Falconers like the main character.

Sound: 8/10

Great sound, no stutters or problems. It doesn't really stand out except at crucial points and the sounds the 'Cullers' make can be a bit creepy. Which is great since they are monsters and suppose to induce a form of fear.

review:
The Falconer's: Moonlight is a supernatural thriller visual novel developed by Bionic Penguin and published by Sekai Project. Falconers are an international consortium of "monster hunters" pledged to protect European colonists from danger as they continue to settle into unknown lands. As the protagonist Cassandra "Cassie" Winters, you are a Falconer sent on your first solo mission to a qaint 19th Century mining town off the West Coast of New Zealand to investigate a terrible accident, missing people and rumors of monsters that stalk the outskirts at night. Can Cassie unravel the mysterious circumstances at work in Moonlight and save the town...turn the page?

Visually this novel is quite impressive and is without a doubt the most cinematic V.N. that I have read so far. From the moment that you have your first battle to the opening credits, the high presentation value of this visual novel is apparent with the camera pans during the action sequences alongside the excellent soundtrack. The illustrations are beautiful with the ever present manga-inspired art yet with an "old west" flavor which combines for a very unique and interesting look that manages to set this V.N. apart from others. Also of note is that the immersion factor is high as there are an abundance of ambient sounds peppered throughout the novel from background noises like people consversating in a bar, doors opening/closing, footsteps and the sounds of combat, etc.. You also have a number of choices to make as the narrative plays out, decisions that can affect how the story unfolds so choose wisely. In conclusion, the presentation of The Falconer's: Moonlight is really quite high and does a wonderful job of setting the stage for the action packed yet supernatural storyline.

Once again, Sekai Project manages to deliver a very solid visual novel experience with this title. I for one hope that this is not a "one-shot" V.N. and that they manage to turn this into a series as I would love to read about more adventures with Cassie and the Falconer's...that sounds like a band doesn't it? Nevertheless, I enjoyed my first read of this title and there are three unique endings available so replayability is very high. Option-wise, there are Steam Achievements to accquire and Steam Trading Cards to collect as well. In summary, this V.N. provided an excellent narrative, a interesting cast of characters and some fascinating lore along with the enticing "old west" theme so The Falconer's: Moonlight is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED to visual novel fans far and wide.

review: The game has choices, true, but sadly except of the occasional alteration of the text they are 100% meaningless. What I could perhaps even forgive if only the game wouldn't make the impression of a decent detective story where the player's job is to identify the culprit from the clues he gets. Alas, I even managed to do so correctly but the game never asked for my opinion and the protagonist made the 'wrong choice' anyway. At this point I pretty much lost the interest and quick-clicked through the rest, confirming myself I indeed didn't miss anything. The only choice which actually matters is the one at the very end offering the usual most boring binary choice between two endings, ignoring everything what happened before. Disappointing to the core, unless you like basically 'kinetic novels' and want to just read a (mediocre) book with pictures on a PC. There is also no alteration of the character based on the choices and whether you act as a bully or a cunning detective, your behavior is hard-coded thruout the whole game save for those 1-2 sentences following each of such choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214444560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1494696067}
review:
If this was the pilot episode of a TV show, it would make one hell of an introduction to Cassie Winter. Our protagonist is freshly solo and eager to prove her competence, riding into town to solve a crime. By your choice, she can be warm and trusting - the better to coax information from soft hearts - or tough and professional, more convincing to those who respect a show of force. This is her first independent mission as a Falconer, and it's a doozy.

[i]The Falconers: Moonlight[/i] showcases both lovely artwork and tasteful use of animation, embellishing what is a solidly compact, suspenseful story. It took me roughly 3 hours (with skipping) to see all 3 endings and get the achievements, so it's worth being thorough and exploring all the options.

As for world building, the game provides just enough detail to immerse the reader - considering its brevity, there's not room to go overboard with superfluous descriptions. Overall it felt an appropriate amount for the length, though I found myself wanting to learn more about the Falconers and their trade secrets (Farlan's remedy, anyone?), as well as their targets, the Cullers. The unconventional setting and the characters were all interesting enough to merit revisting, perhaps in another game.

All in all, I'd say it's definitely worth the money. Well-told and nicely illustrated, with solid fleshed-out characters. If you don't mind the length, you won't regret the purchase.

เล่นจบแล้วมารีวิวให้ 25/4/2017
คะแนนรวม 8.5/10 (ดีคุ้มค่าเงิน)
เกมส์นี้เป็นเกมส์ Virtual Novel ภาษาไทยที่มีอยู่น้อยนิดในท้องตลาด ส่วนตัวแค่เป็นภาษาไทยก็มีความสุขแล้วจึงไม่หวังอะไรมาก (555+) เนื่องเรื่องคือเมืองมีคนตายอย่างปริศนา ผู้นำในเมืองจึงได้จ้างฟอลคอนให้มาสืบสวนว่าคนที่ตายเพราะอะไรและสาเหตุคืออะไร ซึ่งเราจะได้ค้นหาไปพร้อมๆกันในเรื่องนี้
เกมส์นี้ได้อารมณ์ยุโรปตอนที่ไปตั้งถิ่นฐานทวีปอื่น มีปืนแล้วแต่บรรยากาศยังเป็นแบบชนบทอยู่ (แต่ก็ไม่เลว) เนื้อเรื่องสามารถเล่นให้จบได้ใน 3 ชั่วโมง เล่นแล้วก็สนุกคุ้มค่าเงินดี

ข้อดี
- บทเขียนได้ ช่วงต้นช้าๆหน่อยแต่หลังจากนั้นมันก็ไวขึ้น ตัวละครทุกตัวมีเบื้องหลังแรงจูงใจของตัวเอง
- กราฟฟิกวาดได้ดีสวยงาม มีกราฟฟิก 2D แบบ 3D ด้วย
- เพลงประกอบทำได้ดี เข้ากับบรรยากาศ
- ราคาไม่แพงมาก

เฉยๆ
- ไม่มี Feature อะไรหวือหวามากเท่าของญี่ปุ่นแต่คงไม่คิดอะไรมาก
- ไม่มีมุ้งมิ้งอะไรมาก ส่วนหนึ่งเป็นเกมส์แนวสืบสวน อีกส่วนคือนางเอกของเราสายโหด 555+
- มีฉากให้ตกใจเล็กน้อย

ข้อเสีย
- เกมส์ค่อนข้างสั้น (มาก) มีปุ่มให้คลิกไม่เกิน 15 ครั้งมั้งทั้งเกมส์ เสพเนื้อเรื่องเอาก็แล้วกัน

เกมส์นี้ทำได้ดีเลยทีเดียวเป็น Virtual Novel ภาษาไทยที่ดีที่สุดในปีนี้ (แน่นอนละมีเกมส์เดียว) หวังว่าในอนาคตจะมีเกมส์ใหม่ๆออกมาให้ได้เล่นเรื่อยๆ ขอให้ร่ำรวยนะครับสวัสดี

ปล. คุณมีเกมส์ที่ดีนะแต่ไม่ค่อยโปรโมทเลย ถ้าไม่เดินไปเจอที่งาน Thai Comic Con ก็คงไม่รู้ว่ามีเกมส์นี้อยู่ ลองโปรโมทดูบ้างนะ สื่อเกมส์ใหญ่ๆยินดีอยู่แล้ว หรือไม่ก็ลองแจก Key Stream ฟรีให้เหล่า Game Caster ใน YouTube เกมส์คุณจะขายได้อีกเยอะ ผมว่าปัญหาของเกมส์นี้ก็คือ คนไม่รู้ว่ามีอยู่จริง (เป็นห่วงนะเนี้ย กลัวขายไม่ได้)

review:
Shout-out for Bionic Penguin. I recommend this one and suprised more folks haven't reviewed it yet.

This has to be one of the best English VN-releases so far this year. If anything, get it to support a developer who has a lot of potential for even more great future projects. I sincerely hope they continue producing good work. 

Positives:
+ Strong woman lead
+ strong special effects-- from the little things like gun shots, to moving the camera for a more cinematic feel.
+ good music main theme
+ Nice backgrounds
+ well-done art
+ Great location/ world building
+ Pretty good story/plot  ( even though its short)   Think action plus mystery

Neutral 
* No romance  (but that's okay with me)
* many moments without music, but did have atmosphere sounds 
* No voice overs  (again, that's fine with me.  Voice overs aren't mandatory for the visual novel genre). 

Negatives
- was shorter  (but I don't mind shorter vns) 


What I appreciated was that despite the moving effects, the movement stopped mostly when it was time to read. It is a pet-peeve of mine when backgrounds/characters are heavily moving when you are supposed to be reading. It can become distracting.

review:
First of all: the directing is excellent, and for me it's the standout quality of this VN. Heavy use of 3D camera work and animations make the game feel dynamic and alive in a way VNs usually don't. Every shot is constructed with cinematic intent, which also gives the game visual variety and great mileage out of its art assets. There are some parts in the middle that are less polished than the beginning and the end, but overall I think the effort put into the presentation makes it worth its price point even if it's fairly short for a VN (took me around three hours to complete it).

The story itself is enjoyable. The beginning is slow, but once it hits its stride about 1/3 of the way in, it picks up a lot. The plot is well paced with strong progression of developments and a good balance of action and investigation. My biggest complaint is that I found the prose writing very overwrought in places, but the dialogue is quite good, and all the characters are distinct and well written with interesting backstories and motivations. Some of the themes are heavy-handed, but overall it's an entertaining story that effectively carries your interest to its conclusion. If you're looking for romance, there are hints of it here, but only hints.

Sound design and music do an effective job of setting the atmosphere without being intrusive, and some of the tracks are pretty catchy, although the majority of them are fairly forgettable. The art overall is strong as well, although I think the anime proportions + realistic shading looks kinda strange on some of the characters' faces.

Overall, this is easily one of the best English VNs I've played. The good story paired with the great directing makes for a tense monster-hunting action romp, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes VNs, westerns, or supernatural action stories. The main caveat is that it's a little shorter than some people expect VNs to be, but I personally prefer short games and don't find that to be a problem.

review:
A beautifully done, cinematic visual novel that keeps you wanting to read on until the first playthrough is done. Characters have their own life, and aren't your typical run-of-the mill VN sort. But perhaps what I love most about this game is the strong female protagonist who can stand her ground no matter the situation.

Pros:
- Compelling story
- Amazing artwork
- Sound design
- Believeable Characters (and fun too. I <3 me some Biddy)
- Refreshing setting

Cons:
- A bit on the shorter side. About 3 hours for one playthrough.
- Limited replayability. Only three endings.


Overall, I recommend this for people who enjoy well-written stories with a strong protagonist and beautiful artwork. Worth the money hands down.
